p: A total of two hundred eighty-eight one-day-old male Ross 308 broilers were used. Eight groups of twelve broilers were fed one of three experimental diets (8 replicates per diet). The experimental diets were MS, maize-soybean meal with enzymes (MSE), and maize-dehulled lupine seed with enzymes (MLE). The MLE diet was formulated using the chemical composition and AME values obtained in Experiment 1. Table 2 shows the composition of the experimental diets. Enzymes were added following the manufacturerâ€™s recommendations (DuPont-Danisco, Mexico City, Mexico). The enzyme mixture (Axtra XAP 101 TPT, Cedar Rapids, IA, USA) was derived from Bacillus subtilis, Trichoderma longibrachiatum, and Bacillus licheniformis and contained endo-1, 4-beta-xylanase 20,000 U/g, amylase 2,000 U/g and protease 40,000 U/g activities, and 6-phytase (Axtra PHY 10000 TPT, USA) was derived from Trichoderma reesei, 10,000 U/g activity.
